Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. tip Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

This is the summary of a very long blog post, Use a <!-- truncate --> comment to limit blog post size in the list view. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Creating a new WordPress is really easy with InstaWP. In this document, you will learn about how to create a site as a registered user. For guest users, refer to the Getting Started guide.
Once the site is built and listed on your "Sites" screen. You can manipulate the site using various in-built tools.
A typical InstaWP site has two type of logs - Access Logs and Error Logs. To view logs follow the steps outlined.
It is possible to enable SSH or SFTP access for a site. Before proceeding add a SSH public key to your profile by navigating to your profile.
InstaWP sites can be exported to use in your local system or to a hosting provider.

By default a site created on InstaWP has a *.instawp.xyz subdomain. In paid plans, its possible to map a custom domain to any site. This is particularly useful if you want to showcase a site to a client.
By default, any sites created on InstaWP has an "expiry time", meaning the site will be expired and deleted after a set period of time (depending on your plan).

To create a site, click on "Add New" button. [[screenshot-addnew modal]] You will notice various options while creating the site, like: 1. WordPress Version Choose from the stable, old or beta/RC releases. You can also choose the nightly release which will automatically pull the latest nightly version. [[screenshot-wp version dropdown]] 2. PHP Version Choose from 7.x to 8.x PHP version, depending on your current use case. [[screenshot-php version dropdown]] 3. Configuration You can create "presets" of configurations and choose a particular config to automatically set PHP values and WordPress options. With configurations, you can provide a list of plugin slugs, theme slugs and remote URL too. [[screenshot-configuration dropdown]] Go to [Configurations] to know more about it. 4. Custom Name By default, InstaWP chooses a random name for your site, but you can choose to provide a meaningful name to it. 5. Temporary or Reserved By default, a site has a limited life time on InstaWP. You can select "Reserved" tab which will mark the site as reserved and will not let it expire at any point. [[screenshot-reserve tab]]
Once the site is created, you can access the wp-admin admin panel in following ways.
Click on the Access now button to automaticall login to the backend, but since this message is temporary you can also click the "key" icon in the sites table. [[screenshot-access now and key]]
You can also do a manual login via the credentials and URL provided at the time of site creation or access it later via the dropdown menu. [[screenshot-manual login]]
Navigate to https://app.instawp.io/onboard to get started.

Choose a WordPress version, PHP version, preset Configurations and provide a name of your WordPress site. [[screenshot-onboarding launcher]] Click on "Launch Your Website" to get an instant WordPress website based on the parameters you have chosen. [[screenshot-launched site]] Site Limits As a guest user, InstaWP allows you to create upto 3 sites at a time, every site will expir after 8 hours of usage. Faster Launch Keep all parameters as default for an instant launch of new WordPress site!
In the screen above, take a note of your Site URL, username and password, these are details of the newly created WordPress site.

Although you can get started following the steps above, creating a free account gives you several advantages Active Site limit is increased to 5 (instead of 3). Site expires after 48 hours (instead of 8 hours). Access to tools like Code Editor, Database Editor, Log Viewer etc. Dashboard access, See a list of active sites. Unlock features like Configurations, Deployments, Templates etc. To create a FREE account, enter your email id after you have created a site as a guest (this will copy over the site to your newly created site). [[screenshot-launched site-email id]]. Or, you can go directly to user registration and create an account. In both cases, you will be asked for email verification, please open your email account and verify the email address by clicking on the link below. [[screenshot-email verification]]
Once your account is verified you will see a Dashboard. You will also be able to see the site created during onboarding process. [[screenshot-dashboard]]

If you are using LocalWP, exporting a site is as simple as a click. Open the Site dropdown and click on Export -> LocalWP. [[screenshot-localwp-menu]] You will recieve an email after few minutes (depending on the size of your website) with a link to download the zip file. You can then drag and drop this zip to LocalWP interface, something like this: [[screenshot-localwp-import]]

To migrate to any hosting provider of your choice, open the site dropdown and click Migrate. [[screenshot-migrate-menu]] This will open up a list of hosting providers you can migrate to. Select a hosting provider and enter details. [[screenshot-migrate-1]] [[screenshot-migrate-1]] Then click on Migrate and wait for the process to complete. You shall see your target site is replaced with the InstaWP site. Be careful Target website on your hosting provider (as per the provided details), will be overwritten by the InstaWP site.

When a site is expired, we put it in a "expired" state and do not delete it right away. We provide you a 7 day period to "restore" a site before its completely wiped off from our servers. To restore a site click on "Restore". [[screenshot-restore]] Limits on restore Free accounts have a restore limit of 3 times per month, resetting every month end. Upgrade your plan to increase this limit.

You can mark a site as reserved so that it does not expire and it stays in your account forever (unless manually deleted or marked as un-reserved). To reserve a site, there are two ways. 1. Reserve in the new site dialog [[scresnhot-reseerve-modal]] 2. Reserve after a site is created [[scresnhot-site-dropdown]]

If you don't have a ssh key or what to learn more about it, check this guide from Oracle. Copy your ssh key from ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub file and paste it into your profile. [[screenshot-copy ssh]] [[screenshot-paste into profile]]

Once your key is setup in the profile, you can enable FTP and SSH depending on which plan you are on. To enable SFTP access, open the "Access FTP/SSH" dropdown for the site. [[screenshot-dropdown sftp]] Then toggle, the FTP settings and you will see a username and IP address to connect. [[screenshot-view details]] Copy all the details and open FileZilla (or any other FTP client). [[screenshot-filezilla]]

Enabling SSH access is very similar to FTP, in the same modal box, go to SSH tab and enable SSH. [[screenshot-enable-ssh]] You will see the same username and IP address (as you did in the FTP step). Copy these details and open your SSH terminal. Enter the following command to connect via SSH ssh username@IP [[screenshot-ssh-terminal]]

We bundle "Adminer" sql management script with each InstaWP site for quick and easy database editing experience. To access the editor, follow: [[screenshot-dbeditor]] To learn more about Adminer, watch this video.
Similar to the Database Editor, Code Editor is also a click away. It supports multi-tab editing experience right off the bat. [[screenshot-code-editor]]

If you don't remember your WordPress admin username/password, fear not. We have them handy for you. You can either open the "View Creds" section. [[screenshot-view-creds]] Or, you can simply click on the Magic Login (Auto Login) button in your Site toolbar. [[screenshot-auto-login]]
